sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The US Senate has approved an 88.29 billion euro aid package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The bill will now make its way into the House.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Senate approved the measure in a 70-29 majority vote that exceeded the chamber's 60-vote threshold for passage. 22 Republicans joined most Democrats to support the bill. Despite passing the Senate the bill doesn't face an easy ride. Republicans in the House are ideologically aligned with Trump and deeply skeptical about continuing aid to Ukraine in its war against Russia. The bill must pass both houses of Congress to make it into law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian forces appear to have constructed a 30-kilometer-long barrier

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: dubbed the Tsar Train in occupied Donetsk region, possibly to serve as a defensive line against future Ukrainian assaults the Institute for the study of war says satellite imagery dated on the 10th of May 2023 and then the 6th and the 10th of February 2024 shows that Russian forces constructed a long line of train cars stretching from occupied olenivka south of Donetsk City to volnovaha southeast of vuhledar and north of Mariupol over the past nine months a Ukrainian open source intelligence interactive online map of the military operations Deep State reported on the 11th of February that Russian forces have assembled more than 2,100 freight cars into a 30-kilometer-long train. The source reported that Russian forces began assembling the train in July 2023 and suggested that Russian forces intend to use the train as a defensive line against future Ukrainian assaults. The railway line between Olenivka and volnovaha is roughly six kilometers from the Institute for the study of Wars current assessed Front line southeast of novomykhailivka at its closest point and is in the area of the front that was relatively inactive when Russian forces reportedly began construction Russian forces have recently made marginal territorial gains in this area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War says the Russians could have assembled the train for other purposes as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France has condemned disinformation maneuvers one day after national authorities accused Russia of operating a long-running online manipulation campaign against ukraine's western backers in a statement the french foreign ministry said quote no manipulation attempt will distract france from its support for ukraine in the face of russia's war of aggression earlier on monday the country's foreign Minister, Stéphane Sejourné, said a network codenamed Portal Combat, comprising of 193 websites, had been set up with the aim of spreading Russian disinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German defense company Rheinmetall broke ground for an ammunition factory in northern Germany on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Both the German Chancellor and Danish Prime Minister attended the ceremony. The aim is to increase arms production in Europe while the war in Ukraine continues and nine months before the US presidential elections. No matter what will happen in the US in this year, I think the conclusion has to be written already now that Europe needs to be stronger and we need to be able to do more on our own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And I say that even though I'm a true believer in the transatlantic alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Construction is expected to take around a year with the priority being starting production as soon as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to Rheinmetall, production at the site will mainly meet the needs of the German armed forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germany, the second largest arms supplier to Ukraine, plans to invest 2% of its GDP in defense this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees has said he hopes the European Commission will keep funding their operations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In a visit to Brussels on Monday, Philip Lazzarini said it was critical the cash flow to the organization continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The agency is investigating whether 12 of its employees took part in Hamas's October 7 attacks against Israel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Israel has also alleged Hamas has tunnels under the agency's headquarters in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: More than a dozen countries, including several EU member states, suspended funding worth nearly 410 million euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Commission contribution is absolutely critical because it's 82 million dollars expected beginning of March. If we would have had no pause or freeze of funding, our cash flow would have been good until the end of July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Our cash flow will suffer as from now, as from the month of March. It will be negative, expect a negative 30 to 40 million in March, but then it will be significantly negative as from April." The conclusions from the investigation could take months to appear, but the EU's chief of diplomacy, Joseph Borrell, has hinted the European Commission could make some decisions before that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The bloc's 27 countries will have to coordinate a decision on the agency but Borrell says the UN agency for Palestinian refugees is irreplaceable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: If I have to look at the majority feeling I think that the majority clearly it's understanding the fact that there is no alternative to support the Palestinian people than what we have in place and has been in place for 70 years or more with Hamas and without Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So I cannot imagine a magic wand to say that tomorrow someone will come and provide the schools to half a million young people." Lazzarini said that Israel's operations in Rafah, near the border with Egypt, are already disrupting the entrance of humanitarian aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Convoys are also being attacked due to the lack of local police protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While in Brussels, Lazzarini also said for the first time that he would not resign against repeated requests by the Israeli government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: An appeals court ordered the Dutch government on Monday to halt the export of F-35 fighter jet parts to Israel, citing a clear risk of violations of international law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The decision came as Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte traveled to Israel to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Rutte was also expected to separately meet with Palestinian leader Mohammad Chattaya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Human rights organizations brought a civil suit against the Netherlands in December, arguing authorities needed to re- revaluate the export license in light of Israeli military action in the Gaza Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It is undeniable that there is a clear risk that the exported F-35 parts are used in serious violations of international humanitarian law, Judge Bas Boel said while reading out the ruling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The exports must cease within seven days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Spanish police have seized eight tons of cocaine at the southern port of Algeciras, one of the largest hauls it has ever intercepted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The container of high-purity cocaine had traveled from Suriname to Panama and from there to the Spanish coast. It was packed in more than 7,000 parcels and hidden in a false power generator designed to avoid detection from scanners. Its next destination was Portugal from where it would be transported by road back into Spain. Three people are currently under investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Three people are currently under investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Solar panel manufacturers in Europe say the sector is facing an existential challenge from heavily subsidized Chinese competitors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: According to insiders, Chinese solar panel manufacturers have a near monopoly on the sector and if no measures are taken, Europe's industry could collapse within months. European manufacturers have asked the European Commission for emergency aid, including the purchase of accumulated stock to provide liquidity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So China has been subsidizing their industry for more than a decade. They took a strategic decision for more than like 15 years ago that they saw PV as a strategic technology. They have done so in other areas such as electric vehicles and batteries etc. Lower prices elsewhere have made several companies decide to relocate outside of the continent whilst others have made staff redundant. han hecho que varias compañías deciden relocarse fuera del continente, mientras que otras han hecho que los trabajadores sean redundantes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Pero incluso para esos innovadores, y se puede instalar en tejados que no soportan el peso. go down with price levels and being less competitive and profitable. Chinese competition not only endangers companies, but also could affect Europe's industrial independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A module produced in China is about 50% cheaper than one made in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, European producers account for only 3% of the EU market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In the medium term, the EU has two directives almost finalized that could reduce competition. The first would require 40 percent of the clean technologies installed in the EU to be manufactured here as well. The second would prohibit the sale in the EU of products made with forced labor, something that happens in several areas of China. The European Commission has not yet announced any emergency measures and is still assessing the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's important that the solar market in Europe keeps growing because we're still not at the levels that we need to reach the 2030 targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So any industrial strategy for the manufacturing needs to make sure that it doesn't impact negatively the continued growth of the European solar markets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Striking the right balance is essential for the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Solar energy is one of the cheapest and easiest to install, so rapid deployment could make a difference in meeting climate targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: By 2030, 42.5% of all EU energy will have to come from renewable sources.
